org.conqat.lib.commons.assessment

Class Assessment

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.conqat.lib.commons.assessment.Assessment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<Assessment>, IDeepCloneable

    public class Assessment
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, IDeepCloneable, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Assessment>
    This class stores an assessment. An assessment is a multiset of traffic light colors (i.e. a mapping from traffic light colors to non-negative integers).
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Assessment

        public Assessment()
        Creates an empty assessment (i.e. one with all entries set to 0).

      • Assessment

        public Assessment(ETrafficLightColor color)
        Create an assessment with a single color entry.
        Parameters:
        color - the color included in this assessment.

    • Method Detail

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns the size of the assessment, i.e. the sum of values over all colors.

      • add

        public final void add(ETrafficLightColor color)
        Add a single entry of this color to this assessment.
        Parameters:
        color - the color added to this assessment.

      • add

        public final void add(ETrafficLightColor color,
                      int count)
        Add a single entry of this color to this assessment.
        Parameters:
        color - the color added to this assessment.
        count - how often to add this color to the assessment.

      • add

        public final void add(Assessment a)
        Adds the Assessment by merging the provided assessment into this, i.e. increase all traffic light color counts by the values in the provided assessment.
        Parameters:
        a - the assessment to merge in.

      • subtract

        public final void subtract(Assessment a)
        Subtracts the provided assessment from this one, i.e. decreases all traffic light color counts by the values in the provided assessment.
        Parameters:
        a - the assessment to merge in.

      • getColorFrequency

        public int getColorFrequency(ETrafficLightColor color)
        Parameters:
        color - the color whose frequency to read.
        Returns:
        the number of occurrences of the provided color in this assessment.

      • getDominantColor

        public ETrafficLightColor getDominantColor()
        Returns the first color of the ETrafficLightColor enumeration for which this assessment has a positive count. The enumeration is ordered in a way, that more dominant colors are on top. For example the dominant color is red, if at least one red value is in the assessment.

      • getMostFrequentColor

        public ETrafficLightColor getMostFrequentColor()
        Returns:
        the color that is most frequent in this assessment. If all frequencies are 0, UNKNOWN is returned. If there are ties, the more dominant (see getDominantColor()) one is returned.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • toFormattedColors

        public java.lang.String toFormattedColors()
        Return a formatted string of all traffic light colors with absolute and relative values greater 0. Example output: "[R: 2 (20.0%), Y: 3 (30.0%), G: 5 (50.0%)]"

      • clone

        protected Assessment clone()
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object

        public int hashCode()
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Assessment other)
        Compares assessment values lexicographically, i.e. from most dominant color to least dominant color.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Assessment>

      • compareToRelative

        public int compareToRelative(Assessment other)
        Compares both assessments by the percentage of their dominant colors. If equal, returns zero.

      • aggregate

        public static Assessment aggregate(java.util.Collection<Assessment> values)
        Aggregate assessments based on sum of assessment values.
